title.rendered: Quetta vs Peshawar, Pakistan T20 League 2023: Fantasy Team, Probable Playing XIs, Pitch Report & Fantasy Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable Playing XIs for Quetta & Peshawar

Quetta: Jason Roy, Martin Guptill, Abdul Bangalzai, Sarfaraz Ahmed (c & wk), Umar Akmal, Iftikhar Ahmed, Mohammad Nawaz, Odean Smith, Qais Ahmad, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Hasnain

Peshawar: Mohammad Haris (wk), Babar Azam (c), Saim Ayub, Tom Kohler-Cadmore, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Rovman Powell, James Neesham, Wahab Riaz, Khurram Shahzad, Salman Irshad, Sufiyan Muqeem

Pitch Report for National Stadium, Karachi

Venue: National Stadium, Karachi

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 175

2nd innings average score: 158

Wickets per innings: 7

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 66%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Also Read:

India vs Ireland, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023 Fantasy Tips

New Zealand vs Sri Lanka, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023: Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

In 39 games at Karachi, Babar Azam has accumulated 1,711 runs at 61, including the highest score of 110*.

Wahab Riaz loves bowling against Quetta. In only 19 games, he has bagged 34 wickets, including the best figures of 3 for 17.

Besides adding 262 runs at 22, Mohammad Nawaz has taken 24 wickets at The National Stadium. His best bowling figures against Peshawar read 3 for 35.

Through consistent all-round showing, James Neesham has featured in the Best11 in four of the last five matches. He picked two wickets and scored 16* on his previous visit to the venue.

In four innings, Iftikhar Ahmed averages a mere 12 against Peshawar. However, his recent exploits (unbeaten century and two fifties) in his last 10 innings makes him a dangerous prospect.

Jason Roy has managed only 127 runs in his last seven T20s. In this phase, he has been dismissed for a single-digit score on four occasions.

In the last three games at Karachi, the seamers have picked 69% of the wickets.
